page.title: 10FARMING III
page.content: { {Cereal Crops-} Winter Barley is grown more than Spring Barley because this gives a 15% greater yield. Most grain is stored for feeding, some is sold to merchants, and a little to breweries. Harvesting is by Combine Harvester. It is interesting to note that oats are no longer grown. {Root Crops- Birkhall Farm}is the only farm to grow potatoes commercially. Less than 10 acres of turnips are grown to provide some of the winter feed for sheep. {Grass-}Hay is still made although grass is now more commonly used for silage. Silage needs more mechanism. {Buildings-}Large modern asbestos roof- ed buildings allow loose housing of cattle. With a 40-year lifespan there is concern for their future safety. Old buildings are still whitewashed.
